Home > external > kegg > getKEGGModelForOrganism.m

getKEGGModelForOrganism

PURPOSE

getKEGGModelForOrganism

SYNOPSIS

function model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,nSequences,seqIdentity)

DESCRIPTION 

 getKEGGModelForOrganism
   Reconstructs a genome-scale metabolic model based on protein homology
   to the orthologies in KEGG. If the target species is not available in
   KEGG, the user must select a closely related species. It is also
   possible to circumvent protein homology search (see fastaFile parameter
   for more details)

   organismID          three or four letter abbreviation of the organism
                       (as used in KEGG). If not available, use a closely
                       related species. This is used for determing the
                       phylogenetic distance. Use 'eukaryotes' or
                       'prokaryotes' to get a model for the whole domain.
                       Only applicable if fastaFile is empty, i.e. no
                       homology search should be performed
   fastaFile           a FASTA file that contains the protein sequences of
                       the organism for which to reconstruct a model (opt,
                       if no FASTA file is supplied then a model is
                       reconstructed based only on the organism
                       abbreviation. This option ignores all settings
                       except for keepSpontaneous, keepUndefinedStoich,
                       keepIncomplete and keepGeneral)
   dataDir             directory for which to retrieve the input data.
                       Should contain a combination of these sub-folders:
                       -dataDir\keggdb
                           The KEGG database files used in 1a (see below)
                       -dataDir\fasta
                           The multi-FASTA files generated in 1b (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\aligned
                           The aligned FASTA files as generated in 2a (see
                           below)
                       -dataDir\hmms
                           The hidden Markov models as generated in 2b or
                           downloaded from BioMet Toolbox (see below)
                       The final directory in dataDir should be styled as
                       proXXX_keggYY or eukXXX_keggYY, indicating whether
                       the HMMs were trained on pro- or eukaryotic
                       sequences, using a sequence similarity threshold of
                       XXX %, fitting the KEGG version YY. E.g.
                       euk100_kegg82. (opt, see note about fastaFile. Note
                       that in order to rebuild the KEGG model from a
                       database dump, as opposed to using the version
                       supplied with RAVEN, you would still need to supply
                       this)
   outDir              directory to save the results from the quering of
                       the hidden Markov models. The output is specific
                       for the input sequences and the settings used. It
                       is stored in this manner so that the function can
                       continue if interrupted or if it should run in
                       parallel. Be careful not to leave output files from
                       different organisms or runs with different settings
                       in the same folder. They will not be overwritten
                       (opt, default is a temporary dir where all *.out
                       files are deleted before and after doing the
                       reconstruction)
   keepSpontaneous     include reactions labeled as "spontaneous". (opt,
                       default true)
   keepUndefinedStoich    include reactions in the form n A <=> n+1 A. These
                       will be dealt with as two separate metabolites
                       (opt, default true)
   keepIncomplete      include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "incomplete", "erroneous" or "unclear" (opt,
                       default true)
   keepGeneral         include reactions which have been labelled as
                       "general reaction". These are reactions on the form
                       "an aldehyde <=> an alcohol", and are therefore
                       unsuited for modelling purposes. Note that not all
                       reactions have this type of annotation, and the
                       script will therefore not be able to remove all
                       such reactions (opt, default false)
   cutOff              significance score from HMMer needed to assign
                       genes to a KO (opt, default 10^-50)
   minScoreRatioG      a gene is only assigned to KOs for which the score
                       is >=log(score)/log(best score) for that gene. This
                       is to prevent that a gene which clearly belongs to
                       one KO is assigned also to KOs with much lower
                       scores (opt, default 0.8 (lower is less strict))
   minScoreRatioKO     ignore genes in a KO if their score is
                       <log(score)/log(best score in KO). This is to
                       "prune" KOs which have many genes and where some are
                       clearly a better fit (opt, default 0.3 (lower is
                       less strict))
   maxPhylDist         -1: only use sequences from the same domain
                       (Prokaryota, Eukaryota)
                       other (positive) value: only use sequences for
                       organisms where the phylogenetic distance is at the
                       most this large (as calculated in getPhylDist)
                       (opt, default Inf, which means that all sequences
                       will be used)
   nSequences          for each KO, use up to this many sequences from the
                       most closely related species. This is mainly to
                       speed up the alignment process for KOs with very
                       many genes. This subsampling is performed before
                       running CD-HIT (opt, default inf)
   seqIdentity         sequence identity threshold in CD-HIT, referred as
                       "global sequence identity" in CD-HIT User's Guide.
                       The only possible options are 1 (100 %), 0.9 (90 %)
                       and 0.5 (50 %). If other values are provided,
                       CD-HIT is skipped (opt, default -1, i.e. CD-HIT is
                       skipped)

   model               the reconstructed model

   PLEASE READ THIS: The input to this function can be confusing, because
   it is intended to be run in parallel on a cluster or in multiple
   sessions. It therefore saves a lot of intermediate results to storage.
   This also serves the purpose of not having to do redundant
   calculations. This, however, comes with the disadvantage of somewhat
   trickier handling. This is what this function does:

   1a. Loads files from a local KEGG FTP dump and constructs a general
       RAVEN model representing the metabolic network. The functions
       getRxnsFromKEGG, getGenesFromKEGG, getMetsFromKEGG summarise the
       data into 'keggRxns.mat', 'keggGenes.mat' and 'keggMets.mat' files,
       which are later merged into 'keggModel.mat' by getModelFromKEGG
       function. The function getPhylDist generates 'keggPhylDist.mat'
       file. KEGG FTP access requires a <a href="matlab:
       web('http://www.bioinformatics.jp/en/keggftp.html')">license</a>.
   1b. Generates protein FASTA files from the KEGG FTP dump (see 1a). One
       multi-FASTA file for each KO in KEGG is generated.

   The Step 1 has to be re-done every time KEGG updates their database (or
   rather when the updates are large enough to warrant re-running this
   part). Many users would probably never use this feature.

   2a. Filters KO-specific protein sets. This is done by using the
       settings "maxPhylDist" and "nSequences" to control which sequences
       should be used for constructing Hidden Markov models (HMMs), and
       later for matching your sequences to.
       The most common alternatives here would be to use sequences from
       only eukaryotes, only prokaryotes or all sequences in KEGG. As
       explained in the README.md file, various sets of pre-trained hidden
       Markov models are available at <a href="matlab:
       web('http://biomet-toolbox.chalmers.se/index.php?page=downtools-raven')">BioMet
       Toolbox</a>. This is normally the most convenient way, but if you
       would like to use, for example, only fungal sequences for training
       the HMMs then you need to re-run this step.
   2b. KO-specific protein FASTA files are re-organised into
       non-redundant protein sets with CD-HIT. The user can only set
       seqIdentity parameter, which corresponds to '-c' parameter in
       CD-HIT, described as "sequence identity threshold". The following
       non-default parameter settings are used depending on seqIdentity
       value:
       __________________________________________________________________
       |                           |         seqIdentity value          |
       |                           --------------------------------------
       |                           |  1.0   |  0.9   |  0.5   |    x    |
       | CD-HIT parameters         -------------------------------------|
       -----------------------------------------------------------------|
       | Input Dataset (-i)        | raw    | cdh100 | cdh90  | raw     |
       | Output Dataset (-o)       | cdh100 | cdh90  | cdh50  | cdhOth  |
       | Sequence identity (-c)    | 1.0    | 0.9    | 0.5    | x       |
       | word_length (-n)          | 5      | 5      | 4      | 2-5*    |
       | Max available memory (-M) |               2000                 |
       ------------------------------------------------------------------        
       * - word length depends from sequence identity value (see CD-HIT
       manual for more details)

       The table reads as follows: if seqIdentity is equal to 1, then
       "cdh100" set is produced from raw set of proteins. If seqIdentity
       is equal to 0.9, then "cdh90" is produced from "cdh100" proteins
       set. When seqIdentity is equal to 0.5, "cdh50" is obtained from
       "cdh90" protein set. Finally, if other seqIdentity value is used,
       it is obtained directly from the raw set of proteins.
   2c. Does a multi sequence alignment for multi-FASTA files obtained in
       Step 2b for future use. MAFFT software with automatic selection of
       alignment algorithm is used in this step ('--auto').
   2d. Trains hidden Markov models using HMMer for each of the aligned
       KO-specific FASTA files obtained in Step 2c. This is performed with
       'hmmbuild' using the default settings.

   Step 2 may be reasonable to be re-done if the user wants to tweak the
   settings in proteins filtering, clustering, multi sequence alignment or
   HMMs training steps. However, it requires to have KO-specific protein
   FASTA files obtained in Step 1a. As such files are not provided in
   RAVEN and BioMet ToolBox, the user can only generate these files from
   KEGG FTP dump files, so KEGG FTP license is needed.

   3a. Queries the HMMs with sequences for the organism you are making a
       model for. This step uses both the output from step 1a and from 2d.
       This is done with 'hmmsearch' function under default settings. The
       significance threshold value set in 'cutOff' parameter is used
       later when parsing '*.out' files to filter out KO hits with higher
       value than 'cutOff' value. The results with passable E values are
       summarised into KO-gene occurence matrix with E values in
       intersections as 'koGeneMat'. The parameters 'minScoreRatioG' and
       'minScoreRatioKO' are then applied to 'prune' KO-gene associations
       (see the function descriptions above for more details). The
       intersection values for these 'prunable' associations are converted
       to zeroes.
   3b. Constructs a model based on the pre-processed KO-gene association
       matrix (koGeneMat). As the full KEGG model already has reaction-KO
       relationships, KOs are converted into the query genes. The final
       draft model contains only these reactions, which are associated
       with KOs from koGeneMat. The reactions without the genes may also
       be included, if the user set keepSpontaneous as 'true'.

   The Step 3 is specific to the organism for which the model is
   reconstructed.

   In principle the function looks at which output that is already available
   and runs only the parts that are required for step 3. This means
   that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory
   -1b is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   OR multi-FASTA files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this
   step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead
   (see above). If not all files exist it will try to find
   the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2a is only performed if not all required HMMs OR aligned FASTA files
   files exist in the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped
   if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2b is only performed if not all required HMMs exist in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA files or
   HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
   reconstructing the model.

   Regarding the whole pipeline, the function checks the output that is
   already available and runs only the parts that are required for step 3.
   This means that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
   RAVEN\external\kegg directory.
   -1b is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs, aligned
   FASTA files, clustered FASTA files and raw FASTA files in the defined
   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are
   downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above). If not all files
   exist it will try to find the KEGG database files in dataDir.
   -2ab are only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs,
   aligned FASTA files and clustered FASTA files in the defined dataDir.
   This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from
   BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -2c is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs and
   aligned FASTA files in the defined dataDir. This means that this step
   is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see
   above).
   -2d is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs exist in
   the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA
   files or HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
   -3b is always performed.

   NOTE: it is also possible to obtain draft model from KEGG without
   providing protein FASTA file for the target organism. In such case the
   organism three-four letter abbreviation set as 'organismID' must exist
   in the local KEGG database. In such case, the program just fetches all
   the reactions, which are associated with given 'organismID'.

   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,...
    outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,...
    keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,...
    nSequences,seqIdentity)

   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2018-09-06

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
  • getModelFromKEGG getModelFromKEGG
  • getPhylDist getPhylDist
This function is called by:

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function files=listFiles(directory)

0224 %   -3b is always performed.
0225 %
0226 %   These steps are specific to the organism for which you are
0227 %   reconstructing the model.
0228 %
0229 %   Regarding the whole pipeline, the function checks the output that is
0230 %   already available and runs only the parts that are required for step 3.
0231 %   This means that (see the definition of the parameters for details):
0232 %   -1a is only performed if there are no KEGG model files in the
0233 %   RAVEN\external\kegg directory.
0234 %   -1b is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs, aligned
0235 %   FASTA files, clustered FASTA files and raw FASTA files in the defined
0236 %   dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are
0237 %   downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above). If not all files
0238 %   exist it will try to find the KEGG database files in dataDir.
0239 %   -2ab are only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs,
0240 %   aligned FASTA files and clustered FASTA files in the defined dataDir.
0241 %   This means that this step is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from
0242 %   BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
0243 %   -2c is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs and
0244 %   aligned FASTA files in the defined dataDir. This means that this step
0245 %   is skipped if the HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see
0246 %   above).
0247 %   -2d is only performed if any of required KOs do not have HMMs exist in
0248 %   the defined dataDir. This means that this step is skipped if the FASTA
0249 %   files or HMMs are downloaded from BioMet Toolbox instead (see above).
0250 %   -3a is performed for the required HMMs for which no corresponding .out
0251 %   file exists in outDir. This is just a way to enable the function to be
0252 %   run in parallel or to resume if interrupted.
0253 %   -3b is always performed.
0254 %
0255 %   NOTE: it is also possible to obtain draft model from KEGG without
0256 %   providing protein FASTA file for the target organism. In such case the
0257 %   organism three-four letter abbreviation set as 'organismID' must exist
0258 %   in the local KEGG database. In such case, the program just fetches all
0259 %   the reactions, which are associated with given 'organismID'.
0260 %
0261 %   Usage: model=getKEGGModelForOrganism(organismID,fastaFile,dataDir,...
0262 %    outDir,keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,...
0263 %    keepGeneral,cutOff,minScoreRatioKO,minScoreRatioG,maxPhylDist,...
0264 %    nSequences,seqIdentity)
0265 %
0266 %   Simonas Marcisauskas, 2018-09-06
0267 
0268 if nargin<2
0269     fastaFile=[];
0270 end
0271 if nargin<3
0272     dataDir=[];
0273 end
0274 if nargin<4
0275     outDir=[];
0276 end
0277 if isempty(outDir)
0278     outDir=tempdir;
0279     %Delete all *.out files if any exist
0280     delete(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0281 elseif ~isstring(outDir)
0282     error('outDir should be provided as string');
0283 end
0284 if nargin<5
0285     keepSpontaneous=true;
0286 end
0287 if nargin<6
0288     keepUndefinedStoich=true;
0289 end
0290 if nargin<7
0291     keepIncomplete=true;
0292 end
0293 if nargin<8
0294     keepGeneral=false;
0295 end
0296 if nargin<9
0297     cutOff=10^-50;
0298 end
0299 if nargin<10
0300     minScoreRatioG=0.8;
0301 end
0302 if nargin<11
0303     minScoreRatioKO=0.3;
0304 end
0305 if nargin<12
0306     maxPhylDist=inf;
0307     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0308 end
0309 if nargin<13
0310     nSequences=inf;
0311     %Include all sequences for each reaction
0312 end
0313 if nargin<14
0314     seqIdentity=-1;
0315     %CD-HIT is not used in the pipeline
0316 end
0317 
0318 %Check that FASTA file exists
0319 if ~isempty(fastaFile)
0320     if ~isstr(fastaFile)
0321         error('FASTA file should be provided as string');
0322     end
0323     if ~(exist(fastaFile,'file')==2)
0324         error('FASTA file %s cannot be found',string(fastaFile));
0325     end
0326 end
0327 %Run the external binaries multi-threaded to use all logical cores assigned
0328 %to MATLAB
0329 cores = evalc('feature(''numcores'')');
0330 cores = strsplit(cores, 'MATLAB was assigned: ');
0331 cores = regexp(cores{2},'^\d*','match');
0332 cores = cores{1};
0333 
0334 %Get the directory for RAVEN Toolbox. This is to get the path to the third
0335 %party software used
0336 [ST, I]=dbstack('-completenames');
0337 ravenPath=fileparts(fileparts(fileparts(ST(I).file)));
0338 
0339 %Checking if dataDir is consistent. It must point to pre-trained HMMs set,
0340 %compatible with the the current RAVEN version. The user may have the
0341 %required zip file already in working directory or have it extracted. If
0342 %the zip file and directory is not here, it is downloaded from the cloud
0343 if ~isempty(dataDir)
0344     hmmOptions={'euk100_kegg87', ...
0345         'euk90_kegg87', ...
0346         'euk50_kegg87', ...
0347         'prok100_kegg87', ...
0348         'prok90_kegg87', ...
0349         'prok50_kegg87'};
0350     hmmLinks={'13x9tuuux0gkni0grw6fnhjdtziva4tp', ...
0351         'gv8boei9nrt5s1od7da0nrtqx18a1k3f', ...
0352         'f27ofcyu7s7xw1ftjrn864w3c0vgnksa', ...
0353         'u8c7ljqnzzii7oxg6g36lp7cgtgwu4ci', ...
0354         'u3z7s31q5be4zqpmmsxgvfb0ye1x2lez', ...
0355         'rsug46hptvoy7hurooi6fsc1hz2f5b6v'};
0356     if all(cellfun(@isempty,regexp(dataDir,strcat(hmmOptions,'$')))) %Check if dataDir ends with any of the hmmOptions
0357         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file') &&...
0358                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir') &&...
0359                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir') &&...
0360                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0361             EM='Pre-trained HMMs set is not recognised. It should match any of the following sets (which are available to download):';
0362             disp(EM);
0363             disp(hmmOptions);
0364             error('Fatal error occured. See the details above');
0365         end
0366     else
0367         if exist(dataDir,'dir')
0368             fprintf('Provided dataDir is in correct format for this RAVEN version in order to use pre-trained HMMs...\n')
0369         elseif ~exist(dataDir,'dir') && exist([dataDir,'.zip'],'file')
0370             fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0371             unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0372         else
0373             [~,hmmIndex]=ismember(dataDir,hmmOptions);
0374             
0375             fprintf('Downloading HMMs archive file...\n');
0376             websave([dataDir,'.zip'],['https://chalmersuniversity.box.com/shared/static/',hmmLinks{hmmIndex},'.zip']);
0377             fprintf('Extracting HMMs archive file...\n');
0378             unzip([dataDir,'.zip']);
0379         end
0380     end
0381 end
0382 
0383 %Check if the fasta-file contains '/' or'\'. If not then it's probably just
0384 %a file name. It is then merged with the current folder
0385 if any(fastaFile)
0386     if ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'\')) && ~any(strfind(fastaFile,'/'))
0387         fastaFile=fullfile(pwd,fastaFile);
0388     end
0389     %Create the required sub-folders in dataDir if they dont exist
0390     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),'dir')
0391         mkdir(dataDir,'keggdb');
0392     end
0393     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'),'dir')
0394         mkdir(dataDir,'fasta');
0395     end
0396     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned'),'dir')
0397         mkdir(dataDir,'aligned');
0398     end
0399     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms'),'dir')
0400         mkdir(dataDir,'hmms');
0401     end
0402     if ~exist(outDir,'dir')
0403         mkdir(outDir);
0404     end
0405 end
0406 
0407 %First generate the full KEGG model. The dataDir mustn't be supplied as
0408 %there is also an internal RAVEN version available
0409 if any(dataDir)
0410     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0411 else
0412     [model, KOModel]=getModelFromKEGG([],keepSpontaneous,keepUndefinedStoich,keepIncomplete,keepGeneral);
0413 end
0414 fprintf('Completed generation of KEGG model\n');
0415 model.id=organismID;
0416 model.c=zeros(numel(model.rxns),1);
0417 
0418 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then just remove all genes which are not for
0419 %the given organism ID
0420 if isempty(fastaFile)
0421     if ismember(organismID,{'eukaryotes','prokaryotes'})
0422         phylDists=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0423         if strcmp(organismID,'eukaryotes')
0424             proxyid='hsa';
0425             %Use H. sapiens here
0426         else
0427             proxyid='eco';
0428             %Use E. coli here
0429         end
0430         [~, phylDistId]=ismember(proxyid,phylDists.ids);
0431         idsToKeep=phylDists.ids(~isinf(phylDists.distMat(phylDistId,:)));
0432         taxIDs=cellfun(@(x) x{1},cellfun(@(x) strsplit(x,':'),model.genes,'UniformOutput',false),'UniformOutput',false);
0433         I=ismember(upper(taxIDs),upper(idsToKeep));
0434     else
0435         %KEGG organism IDs may have three or four letters
0436         organismID=strcat(organismID,':');
0437         %Add colon for accurate matching
0438         if length(organismID)==4
0439             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:4),organismID),model.genes);
0440         elseif length(organismID)==5
0441             I=cellfun(@(x) strcmpi(x(1:5),organismID),model.genes);
0442         end
0443     end
0444     %Remove those genes
0445     model.genes=model.genes(I);
0446     model.rxnGeneMat=model.rxnGeneMat(:,I);
0447 end
0448 
0449 %First remove all reactions without genes
0450 if keepSpontaneous==true
0451     load(fullfile(ravenPath,'external','kegg','keggRxns.mat'),'isSpontaneous');
0452     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous);
0453     spontRxnsWithGenes=model.rxns(any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous));
0454 else
0455     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
0456 end
0457 model=removeReactions(model,I,true);
0458 
0459 %Clean gene names
0460 for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0461     %First get rid of the prefix organism id
0462     model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(strfind(model.genes{i},':')+1:end);
0463     %Find and remove the description in parentheses if any
0464     s=strfind(model.genes{i},'(');
0465     if any(s)
0466         model.genes{i}=model.genes{i}(1:s-1);
0467     end
0468 end
0469 
0470 %If no FASTA file is supplied, then we're done here
0471 if isempty(fastaFile)
0472     %Create grRules
0473     model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0474     model.grRules(:)={''};
0475     %Add the gene associations as 'or'
0476     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0477         %Find the involved genes
0478         I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
0479         if any(I)
0480             model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
0481             for j=2:numel(I)
0482                 model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
0483             end
0484             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
0485         end
0486     end
0487     %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
0488     [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model); %Give detailed output
0489     model.grRules = grRules;
0490     model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
0491     %Add geneMiriams, assuming that it follows the syntax
0492     %kegg.genes/organismID:geneName
0493     model.geneMiriams='';
0494     for i=1:numel(model.genes)
0495         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.name{1,1}='kegg.genes';
0496         model.geneMiriams{i,1}.value{1,1}=strcat(lower(organismID),model.genes{i,1});
0497     end
0498     %Add the description to the reactions
0499     for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0500         if ~isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
0501             model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat('Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (without HMMs).',model.rxnNotes(i));
0502             model.rxnNotes(i)=strrep(model.rxnNotes(i),'.','. ');
0503         else
0504             model.rxnNotes(i)={'Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (without HMMs)'};
0505         end
0506     end
0507     return;
0508 end
0509 
0510 %Create a phylogenetic distance structure
0511 phylDistStruct=getPhylDist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb'),maxPhylDist==-1);
0512 [~, phylDistId]=ismember(model.id,phylDistStruct.ids);
0513 fprintf('Completed creation of phylogenetic distance matrix\n');
0514 
0515 %Calculate the real maximal distance now. An abitary large number of 1000
0516 %is used for the "all in kingdom" or "all sequences" options. This is a bit
0517 %inconvenient way to do it, but it's to make it fit with some older code
0518 if isinf(maxPhylDist) || maxPhylDist==-1
0519     maxPhylDist=1000;
0520 end
0521 
0522 %Get the KO ids for which files have been generated. Maybe not the neatest
0523 %way..
0524 fastaFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta','*.fa'));
0525 alignedFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.fa'));
0526 alignedWorking=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned','*.faw'));
0527 hmmFiles=listFiles(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms','*.hmm'));
0528 outFiles=listFiles(fullfile(outDir,'*.out'));
0529 
0530 %Check if multi-FASTA files should be generated. This should only be
0531 %performed if there are IDs in the KOModel structure that haven't been
0532 %parsed yet
0533 missingFASTA=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[fastaFiles;alignedFiles;hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0534 
0535 if ~isempty(missingFASTA)
0536     if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),'file')
0537         EM=fprintf(['The file ''genes.pep'' cannot be located at ' strrep(dataDir,'\','/') '/ and should be downloaded from the KEGG FTP.\n']);
0538         dispEM(EM);
0539     end
0540     %Only construct models for KOs which don't have files already
0541     fastaModel=removeReactions(KOModel,setdiff(KOModel.rxns,missingFASTA),true,true);
0542     %Permute the order of the KOs in the model so that constructMultiFasta
0543     %can be run on several processors at once
0544     fastaModel=permuteModel(fastaModel,randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(fastaModel.rxns)),'rxns');
0545     constructMultiFasta(fastaModel,fullfile(dataDir,'keggdb','genes.pep'),fullfile(dataDir,'fasta'));
0546 end
0547 fprintf('Completed generation of multi-FASTA files\n');
0548 
0549 if isunix
0550     if ismac
0551         binEnd='.mac';
0552     else
0553         binEnd='';
0554     end
0555 elseif ispc
0556     binEnd='';
0557 else
0558     EM='Unknown OS, exiting.';
0559     disp(EM);
0560     return
0561 end
0562 
0563 %Check if alignment of FASTA files should be performed
0564 missingAligned=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[alignedFiles;hmmFiles;alignedWorking;outFiles]);
0565 if ~isempty(missingAligned)
0566     missingAligned=missingAligned(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingAligned)));
0567     %Align all sequences using MAFFT
0568     for i=1:numel(missingAligned)
0569         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0570         %parallel process. The faw-files are saved as temporary files to
0571         %kept track of which files are being worked on
0572         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'file') &&...
0573                 ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0574             %Check that the multi-FASTA file exists. It should do so since
0575             %we are saving empty files as well. Print a warning and
0576             %continue if not
0577             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'file')
0578                 EM=['WARNING: The multi-FASTA file for ' missingAligned{i} ' does not exist'];
0579                 dispEM(EM,false);
0580                 continue;
0581             end
0582             
0583             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0584             %file and continue
0585             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0586             if s.bytes<=0
0587                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'w');
0588                 fclose(fid);
0589                 continue;
0590             end
0591             
0592             %Create an empty file to prevent other threads to start to work
0593             %on the same alignment
0594             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'w');
0595             fclose(fid);
0596             
0597             %First load the FASTA file, then select up to nSequences
0598             %sequences of the most closely related species, apply any
0599             %constraints from maxPhylDist, and save it as a temporary file,
0600             %and create the model from that
0601             
0602             fastaStruct=fastaread(fullfile(dataDir,'fasta',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']));
0603             phylDist=inf(numel(fastaStruct),1);
0604             for j=1:numel(fastaStruct)
0605                 %Get the organism abbreviation
0606                 index=strfind(fastaStruct(j).Header,':');
0607                 if any(index)
0608                     abbrev=fastaStruct(j).Header(1:index(1)-1);
0609                     [~, index]=ismember(abbrev,phylDistStruct.ids);
0610                     if any(index)
0611                         phylDist(j)=phylDistStruct.distMat(index(1),phylDistId);
0612                     end
0613                 end
0614             end
0615             
0616             %Inf means that it should not be included
0617             phylDist(phylDist>maxPhylDist)=[];
0618             
0619             %Sort based on phylDist
0620             [~, order]=sort(phylDist);
0621             
0622             %Save the first nSequences hits to a temporary FASTA file
0623             if nSequences<=numel(fastaStruct)
0624                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order(1:nSequences));
0625             else
0626                 fastaStruct=fastaStruct(order);
0627             end
0628             
0629             %Do the clustering and alignment if there are more than one
0630             %sequences, otherwise just save the sequence (or an empty file)
0631             if numel(fastaStruct)>1
0632                 if ~ispc
0633                     if seqIdentity==0.9
0634                         cdhitInp100=tempname;
0635                         fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0636                         cdhitInp90=tempname;
0637                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0638                         if status~=0
0639                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0640                             dispEM(EM);
0641                         end
0642                         %Remove the old tempfile
0643                         if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0644                             delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0645                         end
0646                         tmpFile=tempname;
0647                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.9 -n 5 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0648                         if status~=0
0649                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0650                             dispEM(EM);
0651                         end
0652                         %Remove the old tempfile
0653                         if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0654                             delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0655                         end
0656                     elseif seqIdentity==0.5
0657                         cdhitInp100=tempname;
0658                         fastawrite(cdhitInp100,fastaStruct);
0659                         cdhitInp90=tempname;
0660                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp100 '" -o "' cdhitInp90 '" -c 1.0 -n 5 -M 2000']);
0661                         if status~=0
0662                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0663                             dispEM(EM);
0664                         end
0665                         %Remove the old tempfile
0666                         if exist(cdhitInp100, 'file')
0667                             delete([cdhitInp100 '*']);
0668                         end
0669                         cdhitInp50=tempname;
0670                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp90 '" -o "' cdhitInp50 '" -c 0.9 -n 5 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0671                         if status~=0
0672                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0673                             dispEM(EM);
0674                         end
0675                         %Remove the old tempfile
0676                         if exist(cdhitInp90, 'file')
0677                             delete([cdhitInp90 '*']);
0678                         end
0679                         tmpFile=tempname;
0680                         [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInp50 '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c 0.5 -n 3 -M 2000 -aL 0.8']);
0681                         if status~=0
0682                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0683                             dispEM(EM);
0684                         end
0685                         %Remove the old tempfile
0686                         if exist(cdhitInp50, 'file')
0687                             delete([cdhitInp50 '*']);
0688                         end
0689                     elseif seqIdentity~=-1
0690                         cdhitInpCustom=tempname;
0691                         fastawrite(cdhitInpCustom,fastaStruct);
0692                         tmpFile=tempname;
0693                         if seqIdentity<=1 && seqIdentity>0.7
0694                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 5 -M 2000']);
0695                         elseif seqIdentity>0.6
0696                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 4 -M 2000']);
0697                         elseif seqidentity>0.5
0698                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 3 -M 2000']);
0699                         elseif seqidentity>0.4
0700                             [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','cd-hit-v4.6.6',['cd-hit' binEnd]) '" -T "' num2str(cores) '" -i "' cdhitInpCustom '" -o "' tmpFile '" -c "' num2str(seqIdentity) '" -n 2 -M 2000']);
0701                         else
0702                             EM='The provided seqIdentity must be between 0 and 1\n';
0703                             dispEM(EM);
0704                         end 
0705                         if status~=0
0706                             EM=['Error when performing clustering of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0707                             dispEM(EM);
0708                         end
0709                         %Remove the old tempfile
0710                         if exist(cdhitInpCustom, 'file')
0711                             delete([cdhitInpCustom '*']);
0712                         end
0713                     else
0714                         %This means that CD-HIT should be skipped since
0715                         %seqIdentity is equal to -1
0716                         tmpFile=tempname;
0717                         fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0718                     end
0719                 else
0720                     %CD-HIT is not available in Windows so we just
0721                     %export multifasta file into temporary file
0722                     tmpFile=tempname;
0723                     fastawrite(tmpFile,fastaStruct);
0724                 end
0725                 %Do the alignment for this file
0726                 if ~ispc
0727                     [status, output]=unix(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305',['mafft' binEnd]) '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0728                 else
0729                     [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','mafft-7.305','mafft.bat') '" --auto --anysymbol --thread "' num2str(cores) '" "' tmpFile '" > "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']) '"']);
0730                 end
0731                 if status~=0
0732                     %It could be that alignment failed because only one
0733                     %sequence was left after clustering. If that is the
0734                     %case, then the clustered file is just copied as 'faw'
0735                     %file
0736                     if any(regexp(output,'Only 1 sequence found'))
0737                         movefile(tmpFile,fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),'f');
0738                     else
0739                         EM=['Error when performing alignment of ' missingAligned{i} ':\n' output];
0740                         dispEM(EM);
0741                     end
0742                 end
0743                 %Remove the old tempfile
0744                 if exist(tmpFile, 'file')
0745                     delete([tmpFile '*']);
0746                 end
0747             else
0748                 %If there is only one sequence then it's not possible to do
0749                 %a multiple alignment. Just print the sequence instead. An
0750                 %empty file was written previously so that doesn't have to
0751                 %be dealt with
0752                 if numel(fastaStruct)==1
0753                     fastawrite(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fastaStruct);
0754                 end
0755             end
0756             %Move the temporary file to the real one
0757             movefile(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.faw']),fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingAligned{i} '.fa']),'f');
0758         end
0759     end
0760 end
0761 
0762 if ~ispc
0763     if seqIdentity~=-1
0764         fprintf('Completed clustering and multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0765     else
0766         fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences. Protein clustering was not requested or incorrect seqIdentity value was used\n');
0767     end
0768 else
0769     if seqIdentity~=-1
0770         fprintf('Protein clustering was skipped, since CD-HIT is not compatible with Windows');
0771     end
0772     fprintf('Completed multiple alignment of sequences\n');
0773 end
0774 
0775 %Check if training of Hidden Markov models should be performed
0776 missingHMMs=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,[hmmFiles;outFiles]);
0777 if ~isempty(missingHMMs)
0778     missingHMMs=missingHMMs(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingHMMs)));
0779     
0780     %Train models for all missing KOs
0781     for i=1:numel(missingHMMs)
0782         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0783         %parallel process
0784         if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'file') && ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'file')
0785             %Check that the aligned FASTA file exists. It could be that it
0786             %is still being worked on by some other instance of the program
0787             %(the .faw file should then exist). This should not happen on a
0788             %single computer. It doesn't throw an error, because it should
0789             %finalize the ones it can
0790             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']),'file')
0791                 EM=['The aligned FASTA file for ' missingHMMs{i} ' does not exist'];
0792                 dispEM(EM,false);
0793                 continue;
0794             end
0795             
0796             %If the multi-FASTA file is empty then save an empty aligned
0797             %file and continue
0798             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']));
0799             if s.bytes<=0
0800                 fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']),'w');
0801                 fclose(fid);
0802                 continue;
0803             end
0804             %Create a temporary file to indicate that it is working on the
0805             %KO. This is because hmmbuild cannot overwrite existing files
0806             fid=fopen(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']),'w');
0807             fclose(fid);
0808             
0809             %Create HMM
0810             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmbuild' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' num2str(cores) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'aligned',[missingHMMs{i} '.fa']) '"']);
0811             if status~=0
0812                 EM=['Error when training HMM for ' missingHMMs{i} ':\n' output];
0813                 dispEM(EM);
0814             end
0815             
0816             %Delete the temporary file
0817             delete(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingHMMs{i} '.hmw']));
0818         end
0819     end
0820 end
0821 fprintf('Completed generation of HMMs\n');
0822 
0823 %Check which new .out files that should be generated Check if training of
0824 %Hidden Markov models should be performed
0825 missingOUT=setdiff(KOModel.rxns,outFiles);
0826 if ~isempty(missingOUT)
0827     missingOUT=missingOUT(randperm(RandStream.create('mrg32k3a','Seed',cputime()),numel(missingOUT)));
0828     for i=1:numel(missingOUT)
0829         %This is checked here because it could be that it is created by a
0830         %parallel process
0831         if ~exist(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'file')
0832             %Check that the HMM file exists. It should do so since %we are
0833             %saving empty files as well. Print a warning and continue if
0834             %not
0835             if ~exist(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']),'file')
0836                 EM=['The HMM file for ' missingOUT{i} ' does not exist'];
0837                 dispEM(EM,false);
0838                 continue;
0839             end
0840             
0841             %Save an empty file to prevent several threads working on the
0842             %same file
0843             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0844             fclose(fid);
0845             
0846             %If the HMM file is empty then save an out file and continue
0847             s=dir(fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']));
0848             if s.bytes<=0
0849                 continue;
0850             end
0851             
0852             %Check each gene in the input file against this model
0853             [status, output]=system(['"' fullfile(ravenPath,'software','hmmer-3.1b2',['hmmsearch' binEnd]) '" --cpu "' num2str(cores) '" "' fullfile(dataDir,'hmms',[missingOUT{i} '.hmm']) '" "' fastaFile '"']);
0854             if status~=0
0855                 EM=['Error when querying HMM for ' missingOUT{i} ':\n' output];
0856                 dispEM(EM);
0857             end
0858             
0859             %Save the output to a file
0860             fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[missingOUT{i} '.out']),'w');
0861             fwrite(fid,output);
0862             fclose(fid);
0863         end
0864     end
0865 end
0866 fprintf('Completed matching to HMMs\n');
0867 
0868 %***Begin retrieving the output and putting together the resulting model
0869 
0870 %Retrieve matched genes from the HMMs
0871 koGeneMat=zeros(numel(KOModel.rxns),3000); %Make room for 3000 genes
0872 genes=cell(3000,1);
0873 %Store the best score for a gene in a hash list (since it will be searching
0874 %many times)
0875 hTable = java.util.Hashtable;
0876 
0877 geneCounter=0;
0878 for i=1:numel(KOModel.rxns)
0879     if exist(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']), 'file')
0880         fid=fopen(fullfile(outDir,[KOModel.rxns{i} '.out']),'r');
0881         beginMatches=false;
0882         while 1
0883             %Get the next line
0884             tline = fgetl(fid);
0885             
0886             %Abort at end of file
0887             if ~ischar(tline)
0888                 break;
0889             end
0890             
0891             if and(beginMatches,strcmp(tline,'  ------ inclusion threshold ------'))
0892                 break;
0893             end
0894             
0895             if beginMatches==false
0896                 %This is how the listing of matches begins
0897                 if any(strfind(tline,'E-value '))
0898                     %Read one more line that is only padding
0899                     tline = fgetl(fid);
0900                     beginMatches=true;
0901                 end
0902             else
0903                 %If matches should be read
0904                 if ~strcmp(tline,'   [No hits detected that satisfy reporting thresholds]') && ~isempty(tline)
0905                     elements=regexp(tline,' ','split');
0906                     elements=elements(cellfun(@any,elements));
0907                     
0908                     %Check if the match is below the treshhold
0909                     score=str2double(elements{1});
0910                     gene=elements{9};
0911                     if score<=cutOff
0912                         %If the score is exactly 0, change it to a very
0913                         %small value to avoid NaN
0914                         if score==0
0915                             score=10^-250;
0916                         end
0917                         %Check if the gene is added already and, is so, get
0918                         %the best score for it
0919                         I=hTable.get(gene);
0920                         if any(I)
0921                             koGeneMat(i,I)=score;
0922                         else
0923                             geneCounter=geneCounter+1;
0924                             %The gene was not present yet so add it
0925                             hTable.put(gene,geneCounter);
0926                             genes{geneCounter}=gene;
0927                             koGeneMat(i,geneCounter)=score;
0928                         end
0929                     end
0930                 else
0931                     break;
0932                 end
0933             end
0934         end
0935         fclose(fid);
0936     end
0937 end
0938 koGeneMat=koGeneMat(:,1:geneCounter);
0939 
0940 %Remove the genes for each KO that are below minScoreRatioKO.
0941 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,1)
0942     J=find(koGeneMat(i,:));
0943     if any(J)
0944         koGeneMat(i,J(log(koGeneMat(i,J))/log(min(koGeneMat(i,J)))<minScoreRatioKO))=0;
0945     end
0946 end
0947 
0948 %Remove the KOs for each gene that are below minScoreRatioG
0949 for i=1:size(koGeneMat,2)
0950     J=find(koGeneMat(:,i));
0951     if any(J)
0952         koGeneMat(J(log(koGeneMat(J,i))/log(min(koGeneMat(J,i)))<minScoreRatioG),i)=0;
0953     end
0954 end
0955 
0956 %Create the new model
0957 model.genes=genes(1:geneCounter);
0958 model.grRules=cell(numel(model.rxns),1);
0959 model.grRules(:)={''};
0960 model.rxnGeneMat=sparse(numel(model.rxns),numel(model.genes));
0961 
0962 %Loop through the reactions and add the corresponding genes
0963 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
0964     if isstruct(model.rxnMiriams{i})
0965         %Get all KOs
0966         I=find(strcmpi(model.rxnMiriams{i}.name,'kegg.orthology'));
0967         KOs=model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I);
0968         %Find the KOs and the corresponding genes
0969         J=ismember(KOModel.rxns,KOs);
0970         [~, K]=find(koGeneMat(J,:));
0971         
0972         if any(K)
0973             model.rxnGeneMat(i,K)=1;
0974             %Also delete KOs for which no genes were found. If no genes at
0975             %all were matched to the reaction it will be deleted later
0976             L=sum(koGeneMat(J,:),2)==0;
0977             model.rxnMiriams{i}.value(I(L))=[];
0978             model.rxnMiriams{i}.name(I(L))=[];
0979         end
0980     end
0981 end
0982 
0983 %Find and delete all reactions without genes. This also removes genes that
0984 %are not used (which could happen because minScoreRatioG and
0985 %minScoreRatioKO). If keepSpontaneous==true, the spontaneous reactions
0986 %without genes are kept in the model. Spontaneous reactions with original
0987 %gene associations are treated in the same way, like the rest of the
0988 %reactions - if gene associations were removed during HMM search, such
0989 %reactions are deleted from the model
0990 if keepSpontaneous==true
0991     %Not the most comprise way to delete reactions without genes, but this
0992     %makes the code easier to understand. Firstly the non-spontaneous
0993     %reactions without genes are removed. After that, the second deletion
0994     %step removes spontaneous reactions, which had gene associations before
0995     %HMM search, but no longer have after it
0996     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&~ismember(model.rxns,isSpontaneous);
0997     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
0998     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2)&ismember(model.rxns,spontRxnsWithGenes);
0999     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1000 else
1001     %Just simply check for any new reactions without genes and remove
1002     %it
1003     I=~any(model.rxnGeneMat,2);
1004     model=removeReactions(model,I,true,true);
1005 end
1006 
1007 %Add the gene associations as 'or'
1008 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1009     %Find the involved genes
1010     I=find(model.rxnGeneMat(i,:));
1011     if any(I)
1012         model.grRules{i}=['(' model.genes{I(1)}];
1013         for j=2:numel(I)
1014             model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ' or ' model.genes{I(j)}];
1015         end
1016         model.grRules{i}=[model.grRules{i} ')'];
1017     end
1018 end
1019 
1020 %Fix grRules and reconstruct rxnGeneMat
1021 [grRules,rxnGeneMat] = standardizeGrRules(model,false); %Give detailed output
1022 model.grRules = grRules;
1023 model.rxnGeneMat = rxnGeneMat;
1024 
1025 %Add the description to the reactions
1026 for i=1:numel(model.rxns)
1027     if ~isempty(model.rxnNotes{i})
1028         model.rxnNotes(i)=strcat('Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (using HMMs).',model.rxnNotes(i));
1029         model.rxnNotes(i)=strrep(model.rxnNotes(i),'.','. ');
1030     else
1031         model.rxnNotes(i)={'Included by getKEGGModelFromOrganism (using HMMs)'};
1032     end
1033 end
1034 end
1035 
1036 function files=listFiles(directory)
1037 %Supporter function to list the files in a directory and return them as a
1038 %cell array
1039 temp=dir(directory);
1040 files=cell(numel(temp),1);
1041 for i=1:numel(temp)
1042     files{i}=temp(i,1).name;
1043 end
1044 files=strrep(files,'.fa','');
1045 files=strrep(files,'.hmm','');
1046 files=strrep(files,'.out','');
1047 files=strrep(files,'.faw','');
1048 end
